New Records: Bradley Beal scored 25 points off the bench, shooting 11 of 16 from the field.
Phoenix Suns shot 57.6% from the field, setting a solid field goal percentage.

Key Match Events: Bradley Beal made a driving layup just before the third quarter buzzer to give the Suns a 98-92 lead.
Grayson Allen sealed the win with a tough layup in traffic with 36 seconds left.

The Hawks had a hot start, tying the game at 68-68 by halftime.
Pre-Game Insights: The Suns were aiming to shake a slump with their key players healthy.
The Hawks were struggling without forward Jalen Johnson, who was out with an injury.
Post-Match Reflections: The Hawks fell to.500 after the loss, struggling defensively late in the game.
